page.title: 12Country Landscape
page.content: An undulating countryside, mainly agricultural, with scattered copses of deciduous trees. The grid contains three vilages and also a collection of houses and a primary school known as Lingerfield. There are the remains of small limestone quarries and the more recent scars of sand and gravel works, and flooded gravel pits. Between Farnham and Lingerfield is an area of wetland, Farnham Mires Nature Reserve. A line of electricity pylons marches across the country. The roads run in long shallow curves, a legacy of the times of oxen ploughing, when a wide turn, or selion, was needed at the end of the field. There are two fords, one at Occaney Beck, and another at Farnham.
